name: Bzikebi
description:
'''Bzikebi''' ({{lang-ka|ბზიკები}}, {{literally|Wasps}}) is a Georgian musical group, best known for winning the [[Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2008]] for Georgia with the song "[[Bzz..]]". The group consists of Giorgi Shiolashvili ({{lang|ka|გიორგი შიოლაშვილი}}, born {{birth date|1998|3|7|df=yes}}), Mariam Kikuashvili ({{lang|ka|მარიამ კიკუაშვილი}}, born {{birth date|1998|1|22|df=yes}}), and Mariam Tatulashvili ({{lang|ka|მარიამ თათულაშვილი}}, born {{birth date|1998|4|5|df=yes}}), who were all ten years old during the contest.

They are set to represent Georgia in [[Eurovision Song Contest 2026]], becoming the fourth winners of the junior version to participate in the adult competition, after the [[Tolmachevy Sisters]] in 2014, [[Destiny (singer)|Destiny Chukunyere]] in 2021, and [[Iru Khechanovi]] in 2023.
